alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Grayson; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 27 at 4:16AM EDT until May 27 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Carolina and southwest Virginia, including the following areas, in North Carolina, Alleghany NC, Ashe, Surry, Watauga, Wilkes and Yadkin. In southwest Virginia, Carroll, Grayson and Patrick. * WHEN...Until Noon EDT today. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Abundant moisture will interact with a frontal system to bring moderate to heavy rain to areas which have already seen significant rainfall recently. This is especially true near the crest of the Blue Ridge and along and near the Interstate 77 corridor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
